inn1.comm: back of a length, outside off and cut hard wide of third man
misdirected on to the legs and flicked nonchalently down to long leg
length ball, angled across and swinging away a touch, left by Farhat
shorter, banged in and defended back down the wicket
back of a length again, cut off the back foot - in the air for a while - through gully
wide outside off, cut hard but well fielded just in front of the rope by Bopara
length, outside off, left by Hafeez
similar ball, outside off and left alone
in the corridor, again ignored by Hafeez
pitched up a little more, Hafeez down on one knee ... shoulders arms
directed at the batsman's body, dropped to short midwicket between two fielders
good length, angled across and beats a loose drive
a beauty! Much better from Anderson, tempting length outside off, Hafeez plays back but is beaten pas the outside edge by just a smidge of away movement
shorter, on off, pushed towards cover
on the stumps, slightly back of a length and patted down into the leg side for a quickly run single
on the stumps, forward defensive from Farhat
legside line again as Anderson loses his radar to the left-hander - flicked away to the long-leg boundary
and again! Anderson grimaces as another misdirected delivery is clouted off Farhat's legs, beating the despairing dive of Pietersen at fine leg
room outside off to drive through extra cover for a couple
on the stumps, tickled fine off the pads
good line and length, angled across before fizzing through to the keeper

and this time too good for him! Farhat played way from his body and feathered a nick through to the wicketkeeper. He needn't have played at the delivery, really, as it was full and a little wider than the one before but he was drawn forward and dangled his bat with disastrous consequences ...
taken from off stump and clipped towards square leg
fullish length, outside off and left
on the stumps, popped off towards square leg
length ball, outside off, touch of swing, left alone
banged in a little shorter and at the body, helped off towards fine leg
on middle and off but swinging back further, thunking into Azhar's thigh guard
length ball, defended square into the off side
drops short, wide and slapped hard to deep backward point where Pietersen makes a solid diving stop this time
off-stump line and defended with the full face of the bat
wanged down the leg side, Azhar missing with an attemped glance as he edged across his stump
length, outside off and left, the bat lifted high in the air
off-stump line, defended on the front foot by Azhar
on the stumps, dropped towards midwicket from where the throw comes in - but not quite quickly enough as the bails are broken, Azhar making his ground safely enough
outside off, defended hard square to point
length ball, outside off and deflected down to third man
short, wide loosener, cut lustily on the up away to the deep point boundary
plenty of width again, no stroke ... lucky not to be called wide
he's out! But no, it's called a no-ball! Another roomy delivery was cut hard but straight at Eoin Morgan, fielding at point. But Broad had ever-so-slightly overstepped and the wicket is scrubbed off!
hammered over the cover region, down on one knee, as Hafeez adds insult to injury
slightly overpitched and driven this time through cover for consecutive boundaries! Top shot
again Broad gets the treatment, slashed past point - it's just about fielded on the boundary, though replays suggest it touched the rope and should have been four again
defended on the front foot back to the bowler
middle stump attack, pushed to the fielder at short midwicket
full delivery, towards the blockhole, defended with the toe of the bat
on the stumps and nurdled square on the leg side
full, outside off, attempted drive loops into the air on the bounce
attacking the body, defended to the on side
good length, outside off, played off the outside edge out to point

what a comeback from Broad, inducing a thin edge as Azhar tries to guide the ball down to third man! The delivery was too quick for the batsman, perhaps tucking him up a bit, and the ball scraped the edge of the bat as Azhar attempted a costly dab. After his seven-ball shocker to start with, Broad is smiling again
good length, outside off and drawing the batsman out, beating his stroke
on the stumps, defended
length, outside off with a touch of away movement and left
good line and length again from Broad, pushed back down the wicket on the front foot
length ball, in the corridor, watchfully ignored by Shafiq

another one gone! This has been a harum-scarum opening from Pakistan, making first use of the wicket for the first time in the series. Hafeez got across to one that pitched outside off but nipped back and rapped him in front - it was probably going on to hit leg. Finn is cutting a swathe through the top order again!
front foot, defended back to the bowler from length delivery outside odd
fuller and catches the inside edge as Misbah pushes forward, the ball squirting through his legs
fiery delivery, rearing up outside off and Misbah leaves
on the stumps and nudged to midwicket - and that's the 50 up for Pakistan
length outside off, seaming back and defended on the move, Finn fielding then rounding for a shy at the stumps. You wouldn't get in his way right now
length on off stump, little nibble away and blocked
wide of off stump and left alone
just wide of off stump and left

got him! Misbah's out now and Pakistan really in trouble. He was pushing at a length ball outside off stump, a hint of movement again produces a thick edge to Graeme Swann at slip. Probably could have left it but Farhat decided to push away from his body and nicked off
covered up on off stump
full and driven to mid off
leg side wide
dropped into the off side, Pietersen's in and whips throw to the bowler's end and a hit would have ran Shafiq out
just back of a length and defended off the back foot
another edge but on the ground to second slip
length and blocked back to the bowler
length on leg stump, off the pad and it runs to long leg
length on middle and turned to short midwicket
full and pushed to cover playing forward
length on off stump and blocked forward
length on middle and leg and a leading edge just to the left of the bowler
fuller and smashed over the top for four to deep extra cover, a big swing and a good connection
back of a length and nicely on top of it to turn to long leg
forward outside off and blocked into the leg side
edge outside the off stump, runs fine and Broad slides at short third man to keep them to one
full outside off and dropped into the off side
step down the pitch and drive to long on with a flick
turned to midwicket from outside off
length and played back, punching to the bowler
turned off middle stump to long leg
length and punched to midwicket off the back foot
leg stump, full and turned through square leg, they pinch two as Finn can't come in quickly enough
more length on middle and off and played back towards the bowler
driven down to long off, just past the bowler's dive to his left
flicked from middle and leg to backward square leg
length and angled to third man
defended forward on off stump
good work, forward on off stump, dropped in front of square and they're quickly through for the run
length on off stump and Shafiq tries to on-drive and misses
dropped into the off side but they refuse the single
guided to third man off a length
driven and a great save by Bopara sliding at extra cover saves a single
this time driven straight enough to long off
inside edge and runs through square leg
met on the full but clipped only to midwicket
down the pitch, a big swing, hit on the pad, but way too far down for lbw
a little shorter and cut out to deep point
pushed out behind square on the off side and they charge back for the second
full and a drive and miss outside off stump
leg side, off the pad and it runs away for four to fine leg
length outside off and late cut to third man
full and driven in-to-out to the left of point
length, forward concertedly to block to cover point
skip down and drive, saved by extra cover coming across
forward, this time blocked into the off side
skip down and blocked again
driven to backward point
flighted, driven back to the bowler
driven hard to extra cover
driven off an outside edge to third man
wide and flashed at, off a big top edge but runs quickly and fine to the third man rope
more width, again flashed at but missed
length and angled to point from the crease
length and again a swing and a miss trying to drive from the crease
this time Shafiq gets the cut away and lashes it wide of third man
length and back in the crease to push past cover
driven down to long off
middle and leg and pushed through square leg
delicate sweep to short long leg
sat back and cut to deep cover
dropped into the off side and they take a run
off stump and turned to square leg
premeditated sweep but adjusts and late cuts very well to squeeze it past the keeper, an excellent sliding chase from Broad
skip down and turn to midwicket
tucked into the leg side off a full length

all happening, appeal for lbw, turned down, and now a run out chance and given by the third umpire. It ran off the pad into the leg side, Cook came in and through back to Kieswetter who removed the bails and Shafiq's bat bounced in the air as he slid back in, unfortunate perhaps but he's gone
length and cut to cover
nicely played, timed well and flicked past midwicket for a couple as Patel comes round to field
tossed into the blockhole and dug out to midwicket
little bit of movement away from the right-hander and beats Akmal's nibble from the crease
length and blocked on middle and off
length outside off and driven to extra cover
outside off, Afridi tries to play with the spin but it slides straight on and beats him and briefly the keeper too
this time successfully turned away wide of short long leg
pushed behind square and only half-saved by Broad at short third man
dropped out on the off side
length and Afridi stands tall and punched back to the bowler
forward and blocked just outside off stump
length on middle and off and dropped into the leg side
full and angled down to third man
fine delivery just outside off stump, nips away and beats Afridi's push away from his body from the crease
similar line and pushed into the off side
back of a length and pulled away off the bottom half of the bat out to the man in the deep

full and edged but dropped by Kieswetter, it's a fairly straightforward chance down low to the keeper's right, he went with one hand and it comes off the wrist and runs behind the stumps, could be a bad miss...
goes to sweep and gets hit on the pad
full and smashed way up in the air off a big edge but it lands between the out and in-field
length, balloons off the pad into the leg side
tucked out to deep square leg
played with the turn through the leg side
played forward and blocked with bat and pad together
hit on the knee roll in front of leg but it was heading down and Broad's appeal is rejected
length, close to off stump and Afridi heaves and misses. Not far from being bowled there
length ball on off, squirts off a leading edge down to third man
outside off, pushed to cover-point
fuller, coming back a touch from outside off, left well alone
back of a length and patted down into the leg side
tossed up, quite a bit of spin, chopped towards point
on the stumps, nurdled to square leg
tossed up and played out to point
flighted again, outside off and Umar advances, clouting the ball past mid-on
flatter, Afiridi gives himself room and slashes to deep cover
on the stumps, played off the back foot out towards point
short, not very quick and Afridi rocks back to swing a short-arm pull through midwicket
short of a length and wide on the off side this time, cut hard to cover sweeper
tighter line, just outside off, defended to short extra cover
length, taking the pace off, beats the outside edge as Umar hacks wildly
again misses with a swinging bat outside off
maintains probing line, a bit fuller and defended on the front foot
tossed up outside off and Afridi picks it early, sets himself and heaves a huge six straight down the ground
flatter, quicker, on the stumps and played to leg
flighted outside off, carved over the infield, with Patel coming round to field at deep extra cover
full, outside off and defended coming forward
on the stumps, turning to leg, shovelled to the square fielder
off-stump line, Afridi moves across and plays a cross-batted stroke to long-on
line and length outside off beats the batsman's swing
lenght ball, Afridi tries to hit the cover off it again, gets a run down to long-on
deflected down to third man
width outside off and room to drive on the up ... up, up and UP, it's over mid-off and bounces away to the rope
takes the pace off, beats the outside edge again
length ball, driven on the up towards extra cover, who deflect it to long-off and the batsmen pick up a single
flighted outside off, pushed to cover
outside off, Umar goes down on one knee and scoops the ball over his shoulder, with deep fine leg coming round to field
tossed up outside off, played back to the bowler
off-stump line, defended into the off side
off-stump, turned square by the batsman
on the stumps, clipped out to deep square leg
flat, dropped short and cut off the back foot to deep backward point
on the stumps, nurdled into the leg side
given a bit more air and Umar leans out to defend his stumps, sending the ball back to the bowler
shorter delivery, goes back and pulls through midwicket
off-stump line and chopped back down the ground to long-on
outside off, room to cut off the back foot
outside off, drops back in the crease and cuts hard
tossed up and Umar watchfully defends to short midwicket. 'No' is the cry from his green lips ...
on the stumps and tucked away to square leg
tossed up outside off and swept aggresively to deep backward square where Trott makes a splendid diving stop - that's the 150 up
swept aerially from outside off but it falls in front of Trott this time and he fields on the bounce
quicker ball, in the corridor, deflected to short third man
tossed up on off, played down to long-on
off stump, defended on the front foot
tossed up, clipped to square leg
attacking the stumps and turned off the legs for another single
turned round the corner from off and they force a quick single to short leg
punched down the ground to long-off
short, on the stumps and hooked to deep midwicket
back of a length, attacking the batsman's body, turned down to long leg
short again, played into the leg side off the back foot
fuller length, angling back in and hit on the pads. Strangled appeal from Finn, though it turns out Hawk Eye reckoned it would hit the top of leg. Umar escapes
hit on the pads again and the ball rolls to square leg
back of a length, seaming in and hits Afridi on the thigh, ricocheting into the off side
on the legs, punched to the midwicket fielder
room outside off and chopped off the back foot to point, Morgan moving round to his left
on the stumps, back-foot defensive
targeting the batsman, hooked from in front of the body out to long on
straight delivery, defended on the back foot
middle and leg, looping ball punched to mid-on
quick, low bumper that hits Akmal in the midriff
back of a length again and jabbed into the off side on the back foot
pshaw! Afridi is cut in half by one that screams back at him, short of a length, and beats everything
off-stump line, seaming back and defended
counterpoint from Afridi! Finn has been a ferocious proposition to get away but Afridi seizes on a length ball and, with the field up, uppercuts a drive over mid-off for four
outside off and dabbed to cover
cut fiercely straight to cover-point
still reversing for England's bowlers, punched to mid-off as the ball swings back in
back of a length and played off the back of the bat to point, with Umar looking to work through leg
pitched up and driven to mid-off
off-stump line, guided to point - and that brings up Umar's fifty. He removes his helmet and sinks briefly to his knees
length, outside off and cut to cover-point off the back foot
on the stumps, worked to short midwicket - the fielder misses with a shy at the non-striker's end and Afridi too has fifty. Not yet a match-winning knock but it's getting that way ...
on the stumps, appeal for lbw but it was going to far down leg
length, Umar steps back but doesn't get hold of his baseball-style slug and mid-off field

another storming catch from Patel dismisses Umar Akmal! The delivery was full, on the stumps and clipped towards midwicket where Patel scrambled round to grasp the looping ball one handed at full stretch. It was a tumbling effort - and not the most graceful - but he pouched it like good'un and England regain some of the initiative
length, plays forward and gets a single down to third man via a thick outside edge
leg stump, full and flicked to midwicket
punched to long on
length and angled to point
full and opened the face, edge to third man
length just outside off stump and driven to point

bowled and Afridi's gone and another very important wicket for England. Length ball tried to be whipped into the leg side, Afridi missed, the ball came off the pads and ran onto middle and off stumps. The booming ends to soon for Pakistan
length ball turned to deep midwicket
back foot drive, edged past short third man
defended back from the crease
length, blocked forward
defended on off stump from the crease again
played with the turn to short long leg
length and pushed away from the body and missed
turned off middle through midwicket
length ball slides past the outside edge of Gul's prod forward
full and driven to mid on, pretty well timed
length again outside off and a drive misses
angled into the pads and driven again to mid on
tossed up and turned with the spin to the 45
Gul comes down and pushes out on the leg side, a good save at backward square leg
played carefully again into the leg side
down the pitch and picked up really nicely into the stands, a well timed strike and Gul's power sends it into the chairs
full and blocked forward
tossed up on off stump, blocked into the leg side
length and pushed into the off side
outside off stump and pushed towards long on, three fielders converge and prevent the second
chipped into the leg side, wide enough of long on for two
pushed towards long on again and Patel goes back to field off his own bowling
length, Akmal back and cutting to extra cover
dropped out on the leg side and Akmal turns down the chance of a second
full on middle and leg, strikes the pad, high
full and blocked forward
tucked to midwicket from a length ball
full on middle and driven up on the off side
width and short, cut at and missed
back of a length and played to point
big swing attempted to leg, off a bottom edge into the off side
driven hard to long on
down the pitch and driven to long off
big shot down the ground sails all the way for six, again Gul's power evident, another fine strike
skids on slightly and tucked to midwicket
held back slightly and off a leading edge into the off side, safe enough to the ground
dropped into the leg side, Gul sent back but Broad can't hit from midwicket and Gul survives
very full and dug out back to the bowler

cleaned up and ends a very average knock from Adnan Akmal. He really struggled and eventually falls trying to lift a length ball from Finn into the off side, he's beaten for pace and loses his middle stump. Wasted quite a few deliveries there Akmal, in stark contrast to his brother's fine innings
length on the stumps and pushed to point
whipped away off the hip down to deep square leg
length just outside off stump and tried to be flicked into the leg side and missed
length and a leading edge as Ajmal is square up, it loops over point and runs for two
chipped into the leg side, another run out chance at the bowler's end and again missed, this time by a long way
length and slapped down the ground to long off

bowled him tried to be swung to leg and missed, again off the pads into the stumps. Inswinger from Anderson does the trick, he cleans up Ajmal who tried to swing from the hip, the job nearly done by England
squared up and edged into the off side
full, edged away past Kieswetter and runs for four courtesy off a thin edge
leg side, runs off the pad to the keeper, fortunate because it could easily have ran for four
length and pushed through the covers, Gul can have a go now at these last few
full and swung out to deep square leg
full and pushed away past midwicket and they can take three out towards the deep midwicket rope
full outside off, a big swing takes a huge edge loops over point, Morgan goes back and gets to the ball but can't cling on to the very tough chance
tucked into the leg side, Gul won't come back for some reason sends Cheema back but he's totally stranded and run out by half the pitch

inn2.comm: Length ball, on leg stump, dropped short of square
wide on the crease, room for Pietersen to drive off the back foot - fielded at cover
on the stumps, angled in and patted down short on the on side
short, wide and scorched to the backward point boundary like a ball of potassium fizzing over the surface of a bowl of water
length ball, angled in and turned square by the advancing Pietersen
back of length, bit of kick and Pietersen beaten past the outside edge. Enthusiastic appeal from Gul but don't think there was any bat on that
pitching on leg, defended in his crease
outside leg but jerking across the left-hander, a bit of spit from the wicket means Cook wears the ball on his thigh - the batsman hurry through as the ball loops short of point
down the leg side, flicked off the pad on its was through as Pietersen misses with a glance
straighter, defended on the walk back to the bowler
short of a length, on off, prodded into the leg side
poor ball, on Pietersen's legs and he clips Cheema away between mid-on and mid-wicket
length, on the batsman's body, knocked gently into the on side
back of a length, wide of off and Cook is quickly into position to whip his forearms through a powerful cut shot
straighter, defended back to the bowler
length ball, too close to cut but Cook gets away with it, chopping past his stumps
drops short, hooked in front of deep square leg
length ball, driven off back foot to mid-on, where Afridi misfields to concede a single
touch short and Pietersen punches powerfully off his hips, beating the dive of the man at midwicket and finding a big open space in the outfield
on the stumps, defended on the back foot
short, angled across the left-hander, tickled towards midwicket
length, on the stumps, dropped to leg

very short and wide and Pietersen catches the ball on the toe of the bat with a full-blooded swing. It loops high and not-very-handsome but has enough on it to get over wicketkeeper and slip before trundling on to the rope
straight and full this time, comes off the pads
length, angled in from wide on the crease but swinging too far down leg
outside off and defended ... but Gul had overstepped. Free hit coming up
fuller length, outside off and Pietersen doesn't properly connect with a hook to midwicket
down the leg side - and he's overstepped again. Gul is all over the place at the moment, trying a wee bit too hard
goes for yorker length outside off but Cook gets down to the pitch and crashes through cover. And Gul has overstepped again!
shot! That's the best of the lot! It was slightly back of a length but not too short ... Cook, however, danced back half a yard and KABOOMed a huge pull over deep midwicket!
he gets it right this time, outside off stump, and left
on the stumps, defended on the back foot
length, tight off-stump line and Cook again shoulders arms
slightly fuller, good line across the left-hander but no need to play a stroke
on the stumps, clipped to long-on
tossed up outside off and played to point
defended on the front foot outside off
flighted, driven back and fielded by the bowler
drops short and Cook rocks back to pull aggressively out towards wide long-on
dragged flattter on leg stump and Pietersen advances and is hit on the thigh as the ball bounces and turns a little
defended on the stumps
room outside off, cuts hard through backward point
on the stumps, defended into the leg side
goes back and knocks the ball to midwicket
flat delivery, on the stumps, comes out of the crease and drops to leg
on the stumps again, KP advances and clips to square leg
around the wicket, leg-stump line and clipped into the deep
tossed up outside off and cut hard to the man at backward point
flight again, spinning a fair way to beat Cook's drive
full length, outside off, played square on the back foot
tighter on off, beating Cook's attempted glance. Tricky stuff from Ajmal
off-stump line, played towards cover-point
full, drifing on to the legs and slog-swept over square leg - that's a third successive fifty partnership from England's newest opening pair
goes around the wicket, defended
on the stumps, driven to long-on
tossed up outside off, cut into the ground
full, on off, driven back
straight, angled in on off and there are anguished cries from the Pakistan players as Cook chops the ball away from his stumps at the last second
quicker doosra and Pietersen's forward prod is beaten, the ball fizzing just over the top of off
as if spooked by the previous delivery, Pietersen leaves his crease and nudges one to square leg
tossed up outside off, straightening, Cook beaten sweeping, hit on the pads ... appeal turned down on the grounds it was probably outside the line
off-stump line, played back to the bowler
room outside off to cut and this time Cook puts it away
on the stumps, worked to leg
around the wicket, outside off and nurdled into the on side
shorter delivery, room outside off and Cook glances the ball to third man. No stopping him at the moment
quicker, flatter, worked from off stump to short fine leg
tossed up on the stumps, driven wide of mid-on
length, outside off, Cook plays back and punches to long-on
on the stumps, Pietersen leaves the crease and defends on to the wicket
on off, defended back to the bowler
on off, inside edge to backward square leg
punched down the ground to long-on
outside off, driven in front of square
off-stump line, flatter delivery, pushed to long-off
on the stumps, defended to leg
tossed up and Pietersen mullers a drive straight down the wicket ... and into the stumps at the non-striker's end
defended on the stumps
the googly, hits Pietersen on the pad before rolling to fine leg
turned to square leg
beaten trying to drive off the back foot outside off. It was quick and turned a little - and Pietersen curses himself for a rash stroke
straight, driven down the ground
outside off, turning gently in and clipped to midwicket
drops a touch shorter, Pietersen advances and pats the ball to short midwicket
tossed up, defended on the stumps
tossed up, Pietersen gets out of his crease again and drives to long-on
drops short but Cook's pull flies straight to the man at midwicket
fuller ball, nudged out towards deep midwicket
tickled off his legs to backward square
driven back, Afridi gets a hand on it but can't stop the run
tossed up, Cook leans forward and drives to extra-cover, where a misfield aids the batsman
flighted, driven hard to wide long-off
slanted outside off, Cook cuts like an enthusiastic Conservative minister and only some energetic fielding prevents another boundary
full, picked up early and launched down the ground, all the way over the head of the backpedalling long-off. A cracking stroke, KP looks to back in his pomp
tossed up, defended
full, outside off, prodded to point
off-stump line, played with the turn out to point again
fractionally short but Cook hops back into place like cat pouncing on a mouse and punches a business-like pull shot in front of square
on the stumps, blocked on the front foot
touch short, on off stump and knocked into the off side

length outside off, driven just in front of point, Akmal throws at the non-striker's end as they take a single, the ball ricochets off the stumps and away to the boundary...not exactly the start Pakistan were after
wide and cut out to deep cover
block into midwicket, they're at it again! Fire at the stumps hits, totally unnecessary because Pietersen was home by yards, thankfully it's backed up this time
leg stump and worked off the hip out to deep square leg

back of a length and pulled with perfect timing but straight to the fielder! But dropped! It was straight to Azhar Ali coming in off the rope but it goes through his hands, hits him and runs away allowing the batsman to take two
short and again and beats Pietersen's pull and hits him in the guts
middle stump and pushed to midwicket
full and pushed out to deep square leg
down the pitch and blocked
fuller and pushed back to the bowler
down the track again, fired in, adjusted and blocked off the pad into the leg side
and again to end the over
short and paddled down to long leg
short and pulled into the deep off a bit of a bottom edge
slower ball and blocked outside off stump
back of a length and Cook is in such good nick he's back on this in a flash to hammer it away to the midwicket fence right off the meat of the bat
another slower ball and blocked again on off stump
cut off a bottom edge, nearly dragged on, it runs to short long leg
a paddle sweep over the keeper's head runs away to fine leg
down the pitch, fired in by Ajmal, blocked by Pietersen
length outside off and flashed away past point, runs out towards the boundary
blocked forward on off stump
length and tucked into the leg side off the back foot
full and pushed to midwicket
length and pulled down to long on
length and nudged to midwicket
outside off and Pietersen goes to sweep, then reverse sweep, then scoop but in the end misses with every idea
length and punched to long on
outside off, skids on and cut with a low flick to point
length and played forward back to the bowler
length on leg stump, strikes the pad, appeal for lbw, not out and they have a conversation but refuse the review
dragged down a touch and back foot punched to deep cover
googly outside off and beats Cook's attempted cut, ended up very wide but not called
skids onto the off stump and Cook pushes it back to the bowler
forward again and pushed to extra cover
another googly but Cook onto it and cutting out to deep cover
oh dear, a rank long hop and smashed to the midwicket fence
pushed down the ground for more runs to long off
premeditated paddle sweep behind square, delicately flicked
forward and driven back to the bowler
back of a length and driven out to long off
huge, huge hit from Pietersen down the ground with expert timing into the stands, straight as a dye over the bowlers head after a little skip down the pitch
full and driven to long off
tossed up and driven comfortably down to long off
cut out to deep cover
outside off stump and Pietersen got down to try and slog sweep, he gets a bottom edge and runs it to deep square leg
blocked on off stump going back
forward and blocked this time
length on leg stump and pushed out to deep midwicket
long on is at least up but he's been beaten here by a lovely on-drive by Pietersen, wristily picked up off a full length and timed to perfection to the long on rope
driven again, this time off a more good length, wide of mid off, not timed well enough to get it past the fielder though
outside off, dropped into the covers and an easy run
short and Pietersen pulls and misses
aerially but Pietersen is in good touch now and finding all the gaps, this goes between cover and mid off and races to the fence
cut out to deep point
cut again, this time away from the sweeper so they can get two
full and driven with a good stride to long off
steps back and cuts but only as far as extra cover
tossed up outside off and Pietersen reaches for it and drives off a bottom edge to long on
Cook now stepping away to cut but can only find the fielder
tries to go big first ball and it's off an outside edge over extra cover, didn't pick up the delivery and get to the pitch
safer stroke, paddle swept out to deep square leg
full and driven out to deep cover
turn down the leg side, wides called, and it runs away towards the fine leg boundary
tucked off the back foot to cover
full and tucked off the front foot to deep midwicket
blocked on off stump
full and a lovely on drive, long on comes round to prevent four
back of a length and tucked to extra cover, another no-ball! Gul's had a stinker today
short and hammered to the midwicket fence, another great shot from Cook who's used the free hits today
short outside off, mercifully not called wide on height
length outside off, a push and miss from the crease
pressed forward outside off to extra cover
length and angled to third man
full and driven to the right of extra cover

oh out! Turn away from Cook takes a faint edge through to Akmal who takes a simple chance. A wicket from nowhere and it's a decent nut that ends Cook's stay 20 from a record third consecutive ODI hundred. He pressed forward to a length ball and nicked it to the keeper. Shame for Cook but can't affect this result
blocked on off stump
pressed forward and blocked again
doosra past the inside edge onto the pad playing forward
tossed up outside off just about plays inside the line
length and tucked to midwicket, no fielder at home so Gul chases back and they take two
length again and tucked to square leg off the hip
length and tucked into the leg side
full outside off and blocked forward
back of a length and tucked into the off side
pushed to the right of mid off for a quick single
length and defended into the off side
full and hammered over long on for six. A beautiful strike, so well timed and it sails over the fence
now a sweep, well connected out to the man in the deep, who returns well and has Morgan scampering
defended on off stump
stays back and defends a length ball
now forward to block and end the over
length and blocked off an inside edge and off the pad
a genuine nick with Pietersen playing quite lazily from the crease, it flashes past the keeper and to third man for four
length, Pietersen plays across hit and gets hit, cry for lbw, turned down, outside the line and high
full and played back to the bowler
length but too wide and smashed for four through extra cover, a step down the pitch and whack through the off side, great shot but poor bowling
back foot drive just wide of mid off so KP keeps the strike
tossed up, sliced through cover off an outside edge
dropped! Thin edge from Morgan, who does a passable impression of both his brothers and shells it. Ajmal gives him a dead-eyed stare
on the stumps, defended
again blocked on off
outside off, stroked down the ground
around the wicket, on the stumps, thick outside edge to backward point
short, wide and rising, Morgan fails to connect with a wild slash
better length and line, again beating the outside edge
fuller ball, again angled across Morgan, who drives into the ground to mid-off
length, on the stumps, driven to mid-on
drops short, flicked wristily to deep backward square
length, on the stumps, defended into the on side where Cheema fields
looping, bouncing ball, landing on off and turning away ... too much room for Pietersen, who slaps a drive past extra-cover
on the stumps, jabbed away defensively on the back foot
wide of off and turning further - left
tossed up, driven down the ground
googly, given some air, chopped into the ground towards point
short, leg side and swivel-pulled down to long leg
room to cut outside off stump and hit hard to third man, who fields and then falls over, as if a rug had been pulled from under his feet
defended back down the wicket, Cheema fields and throws down the stumps - but KP is back in his crease
length, outside off, driven on the up to extra-cover

touch short, Pietersen walks across and bunts it off his hips in familiar style - he's properly chuffed, and why not? He removes his helmet and displays that familiar roundhouse fistpump. That's his first ODI hundred in more than three years
short, hammered down the ground on the back foot. Babe Ruth couldn't have hit that better
well wide of off and clattered to deep backward square
on the stumps, chopped to point
off-stump line, driven back
looped up, a full toss really, and driven from under his nose through extra cover. England are almost there
outside off, cut hard to the point fielder
turned off his legs this time, to deep backward square
tossed up and humped back over Afridi's head to the boundary
length, knocked to short midwicket
room outside off to drive and Pietersen does so viciously ... it goes straight through the extra-cover fielder and all the way to the rope. So, that's how to win ODI cricket in Asia - simples
